s.text: By the time she was finished, one could only conclude that Bill Clinton was predestined to win re-election.
But unfortunately, we have to sit and wait for studies that are underway to finish before we can predict the future with something more statistically powerful than hope.
The "one sense" he is referring to about the epidemic not being over is directed at newly infected people and those who can't access or afford the drugs.
True, I have written a great deal about AIDS vaccines, and I have a particular interest in the subject.

Sullivan's article, as its subhead states, is an exploration of the "twilight of an epidemic" that reflects repeatedly on why it is difficult for HIV-infected gay men, in particular, to consider the possibility that new drug regimens will allow them to survive this plague.
